thread.title: Holidaymakers need to renew passports NOW in case of no deal Brexit

author: Jon Lewis
title: Holidaymakers need to renew passports NOW in case of no deal Brexit
text:
Holidaymakers need to renew passports NOW in case of no deal Brexit The advice has been issued by the Government Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox Subscribe Thank you for subscribing See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email
The Government has issued an urgent passport warning to holidaymakers travelling to Europe.
Officials say those looking to travel to the continent after the EU leave date should renew their passports as soon as possible.
Those who don't could get barred from Europe if a no deal Brexit happens.
If you're going on holiday to Europe after March 29, 2019 next year and have less than six months left on your passports, you should renew before you travel.
This is to avoid any possibility of holidaymakers' passports not complying with the Schengen Border Code, reports The Mirror . Read More
It is possible that some valid British passports will be completely useless in our neighbouring countries if we leave the EU without striking a deal. Passport prices are going up today (Image: Getty)
The documents state: "If you plan to travel to the Schengen area after 29 March 2019, to avoid any possibility of your adult British passport not complying with the Schengen Border Code we suggest that you check the issue date and make sure your passport is no older than 9 years and 6 months on the day of travel.
"For example, if you're planning to travel to the Schengen area on 30 March 2019, your passport should have an issue date on or after 1 October 2009. poll loading Should Britain leave the EU? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
